alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 4:56AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Ulster County through 530 AM EDT... At 456 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles west of Woodland Valley Campground, or 19 miles southwest of Hunter, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Woodland Valley Campground, West Shokan, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Kerhonkson, Mount Tremper, Olivebridge, Denning, Cherrytown, Palentown, Atwood, Oliverea, Pacama, Brodhead, Liebhardt, Fantinekill, Morgan Hill, Mombaccus, Seager, Boiceville and Wittenberg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
